sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Open for negotiations, but only if our demands are met, Putin tells Turkish leader Erdogan in Sochi during talks to revive Ukraine grain deal.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Political battle in Brussels over an increase of the EU budgets due to Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_17
sentences.sentence: The UN is gathering evidence against Russia over war crimes in Ukraine but says the word genocide can still not be used.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_19
sentences.sentence: The burning of a Quran in Sweden by an Iraqi activist leads to huge riots in Malmo.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_19
sentences.sentence: Russian President Vladimir Putin sits down for talks in Sochi with Turkish leader Recep Tayyip Erdogan.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Turkey is trying to persuade Russia to revive the wartime deal that allowed Ukraine to export grain and other commodities from three Black Sea ports.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: At the start of the meeting, Putin said Russia is open for negotiations, but only if its demands are met.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Moscow broke off the deal after complaining that a parallel agreement promising to remove obstacles to Russian exports of food and fertilizer hadn't been honoured, and in turn had hampered its trade.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Erdogan has repeatedly called for renewed arrangements that would help avoid deepening a food crisis in parts of Africa, the Middle East and Asia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Ankara has been an ongoing mediator between Ukraine and Russia from the early beginnings of the war and wants the grain deal to resume as part of broader peace talks. The European Union needs more money.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Politically, this marks the beginning of a battle to increase the EU budget, a fight that has only just begun.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: First, for the new Ukraine facility, which is to support the country with 50 billion euros from 2024 to 2027.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The funds will be divided into grants and loans along the lines of the historic Marshall Plan.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The European Parliament has approved the European Commission's proposal to revise the budget.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: We will be in a position to support the government.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: They are setting up a Ukraine plan that is for the reconstruction and pre-accession we will promote also private investment and ensure that and continue our expertise for all those who are active in the in the reform program the Ukraine facility represents half of the almost 100 billion euros that the European Commission is asking for to reinforce the current 2021-27 budget.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The other half would be for six topics.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Migration, a sovereign fund for the industrial plan, interests on the debt related to the pandemic recovery program, staff costs and a contingency reserve.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The Budget Committee wants an increase of another 10 billion euros.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: A combination of government contributions and new sources of revenue, such as taxes on global companies and on financial transactions, is planned.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: However, the Parliament is opposed to cuts in current programmes.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: We have to protect the cohesion policy and the cohesion financing and the common agricultural policy. Nós temos que proteger a política de coesão e o financiamento da coesão e da política agrícola comum.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Ou seja, são políticas que fazem parte do tratado, dos tratados da União Europeia, desde o início da Constituição da União Europeia e são recursos fundamentais que em momento nenhum podem ser cortados. touch. This ambition is likely to meet resistance from the European Council as several member states are unwilling to pay more into Brussels's coffers or incur new joint debt. However, analysts believe that the EU will have to adapt to a new global reality. These seven-year budget cycles with very long negotiations, very protracted, complex things, it doesn't really work in a world where there are very immediate challenges and where there has to be much faster response.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: At the moment the EU budget is also pretty small. It's only a maximum of 1% of EU GDP.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: And it's very likely that more fiscal needs are foreseen.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: At the start of the European election campaign and against the backdrop of the inflation crisis, the budget increase is a test of the EU's solidarity and enlargement ambitions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_17
sentences.sentence: A mission established by the UN to investigate human rights violations by Russian forces in the Ukrainian war has gathered new evidence of killings, illegal detentions, torture, sexual violence and other abuses that in some cases could amount to crimes against humanity.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: We are investigating this step by step.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: As of now, we do not have sufficient available evidence to meet the legal qualifications in the Genocide Convention. The violations include willful killings, unlawful confinement, torture, rape and other sexual violence, unlawful transfer and deportation.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: And some of them may, if confirmed by further evidence, amount to crimes against humanity.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_17
sentences.sentence: The UN stressed the importance of Russian authorities to ensure that all perpetrators are held accountable.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_17
sentences.sentence: The Commission also investigated violations by the Ukrainian armed forces, but found few.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_17
sentences.sentence: Inflation and ever-increasing prices have driven the Czechs to shop abroad, especially

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_18
sentences.sentence: to Poland, where prices in the shops are up to 30% cheaper, not only for groceries, but also for more expensive items such as clothing, electronics and even furniture.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: We drive here at least once a week, because the products here are either cheaper or the same price, but then they are better.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: I buy a full basket and it looks like it's against the Czech Republic, as if the basket would be half.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_18
sentences.sentence: Although inflation has fallen from a high of almost 30% to 14.3%, the rate in the Czech Republic is still one of the highest among OECD countries.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_18
sentences.sentence: Traders have also increased their margins.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Not only was inflation very high here, but what Czechia is also suffering from is that even from afar the city has not reached such a level of growth that it can even balance the inflation.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_18
sentences.sentence: Bankers are also concerned about lost income for the Czech Republic's government.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_18
sentences.sentence: If retail sales fall, so do VAT revenues.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_18
sentences.sentence: The strong Czech crown is also helping to make purchases more convenient, which is why Czechs are increasingly buying foodstuffs and other goods in neighbouring countries such as Germany, Austria and Slovakia.
